A commission profit plan is
offered by the '53 yearbook's business department.
Men are needed to procure ads
for the '53 Hullabaloo especially
during the summer months. A ten
per cent commission of total ads
gotten is offered to those who gain
200 dollars or more in advertising.

—LAST ISSUE—

Dorm Plans
Developing

An architect has been retained
by the University to develop preliminary plans for a new dormitory, Plant Manager Wesley A.
Taylor announced this week.
The firm—Wrenn, Lewis, and
Jenks—will work with Taylor in
preparing ideas of capacity and
facilities the new dorm will have.
No definite place has been assigned for the building, though the
wooded area south of the baseball field has been considered
for a dormitory at right angles to
the present one.
Taylor said he could not specify
any time for completion of plans.
Last week, he investigated the
1100-man dormitory at the University of Michigatt, to see the
newest ideas in the field actually
in practice.

Homewood, Baltimore, May 23, 19521 Hof

I think, in view of the recent
heated controversy- caused by the
reasoned comments of Gene Sekulow in this column, that at the
end of the year—and we might
add, finally—the Traffic Commission of the outgoing Student Council deserves a hearty pat on the
back from the entire student body.
The seven-point program tendered by the Conimission to the
faculty was probably the best and
most concrete list of positive
recommendations for the muchneeded solution of car cares on

the basement of Levering.

on the campus faster than a

He's listened to the weak thread of so many
shallow claims he's fed-up! His point is—there's
a thorough test of cigarette mildness. Millions

of smokers throughout America concur.
The Manhattan Vericooll

The Manhattan Burt!

A warm-weather wonder with

inviting every breeze, keeping you cool and collected.

Mildness Test, which simply asks you to try
Camels as your steady smoke—on a day-after-day,

—LAST ISSUE—

Dorm Plans
Developing

An architect has been retained
by the University to develop preliminary plans for a new dormitory, Plant Manager Wesley A.
Taylor announced this week.
The firm—Wrenn, Lewis, and
Jenks—will work with Taylor in
preparing ideas of capacity and
facilities the new dorm will have.
No definite place has been assigned for the building, though the
wooded area south of the baseball field has been considered
for a dormitory at right angles to
the present one.
Taylor said he could not specify
any time for completion of plans.
Last week, he investigated the
1100-man dormitory at the University of Michigatt, to see the
newest ideas in the field actually
in practice.

Homewood, Baltimore, May 23, 19521 Hof
